author: deme1744
content:
Well, hopefully not, but is it?
e.g. Nethermind has set ⁨⁨`off`⁩⁩ currently in the ⁨⁨`Discv5 setting`⁩⁩. So there is no indication if this will be default turned on at some fork.
We would be happy to default turn off discv4 in Nimbus, but without indication/commitment that other clients will default turn on discv5, it could have an impact on the network and/or users of that specific client that does turn off discv4 default.

author: deme1744
content:
This is why imo it would be good that client teams commit to enabling default discv5 in some release before a hard fork. 
So that their users have to upgrade then their client before the hardfork and you get discv5 enabled over all clients.
And then client teams can make releases as they see fit that default disables discv4.
